intro: Ebermaiera longispica, commonly known as the long-spined ebermaiera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves with long, slender leaflets. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Ebermaiera longispica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
